name: places/ChIJi9L0d3ZZwokRqHtMvYsTSmw
formattedAddress: 215 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 215 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009-3459, USA

editorialSummary.text: Pint-sized market with basic Mexican staples & a counter serving classic take-out eats like tacos.

originalText.text: Probably the best burrito in Manhattan and compared to what’s in SLC. We were visiting from SLC and came across this Mexican market. I wouldn’t say this is a full experience restaurant but a market with a handful of tables where you can enjoy the best burritos out there. Service was excellent. Very accommodating to our 4 people family. They even brought us some sweet bread on the house. Just amazing.

text.text: Probably the best burrito in Manhattan and compared to what’s in SLC. We were visiting from SLC and came across this Mexican market. Very accommodating to our 4 people family. They even brought us some sweet bread on the house. Just amazing.

originalText.text: In my opinion the BEST Mexican food in Manhattan. Chips and Guacamole are fresh and authentic. Overall great atmosphere, owners are so friendly and their cat will keep you company while you wait on food. He literally just crawled into my lap and would not get off. Broke my heart having to get him off when my to go order had been ready for 5 minutes. 10/10 recommend

text.text: In my opinion the BEST Mexican food in Manhattan. Chips and Guacamole are fresh and authentic. Overall great atmosphere, owners are so friendly and their cat will keep you company while you wait on food. He literally just crawled into my lap and would not get off. Broke my heart having to get him off when my to go order had been ready for 5 minutes. 10/10 recommend

originalText.text: My favorite burrito spot in all of Manhattan. Get chicken, beef or cow tongue, all delicious. They're also relatively large so you could count on being full at the end of the meal. Friendly staff is also a plus. And it's a small deli grocery store so you could get a few knick knacks while you're there.

text.text: My favorite burrito spot in all of Manhattan. Get chicken, beef or cow tongue, all delicious. They're also relatively large so you could count on being full at the end of the meal. Friendly staff is also a plus. And it's a small deli grocery store so you could get a few knick knacks while you're there.

originalText.text:
This has to be the smallest shop to offer Mexican food and still pull off being a grocery at the same time. I don’t think 6 people can fit in there at once but you should try.

This little mom and pop Roa I spot offer a just right selection of tacos, burritos and other Mexican offerings.

Not sure the hours but I would suggest hitting this spot on your way home after a night out or on a lazy Sunday.

originalText.text:
People always ask me why they should support local businesses and this is why! Zaragoza is a family owned business that survived. The food is amazing and this is what makes NY unique. I hate to go on a rant but the city needs to protect local businesses that have served communities pre-gentrification. ( Yes I said what I said!) These businesses provide residents with authentic meals that are made with care and love! It’s unfortunate that most of them close when they are staples in the community.

What I love of about this bodega is that they offer authentic Mexican beverages and snacks as well as a flexible menu! The menu literally changes daily and you can mix and match dishes. On my first visit I ordered meatballs and pernil.

Today I ordered goat and beef tongue! When I was a kid I ate what my my prepared, so the menu here definitely reminds me of that. If you live in this area or you are visiting please show this business some love!!! Support the legacy!
